title: Average Acceleration of Cart During Collision

content.question:
Cart <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Cart <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Mass
<math alttext="1 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>k</mtext><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="0.5 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>k</mtext><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Average force
<math alttext="30 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="F sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

Average acceleration
<math alttext="30 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="a sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

The incomplete data in the table above were recorded during an experiment in which two carts on a frictionless one-dimensional track collided head-on. What are the magnitudes of the average force <math alttext="F sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> exerted on cart <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the average acceleration <math alttext="a sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of cart <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> during the collision?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
